questions.text: A 25-year-old female patient had to undergo a cesarean section in an institution due to a complicated delivery. She was discharged on her 5th-day postpartum. How many visits by an ASHA worker is recommended in this case?

A study was done to assess nutritional status among young children in rural and urban areas. 30 children in rural and 20 children in urban areas were malnourished. Which of the following tests of significance is the most appropriate in this case?
A 6-yr-old boy is brought to the clinical psychologist for evaluation of intellectual disability. Which formula will she use to calculate the IQ of the child?
questions.correct_answer: C. Mental age x 100 / Chronological age

questions.text: While reviewing a data distribution, you find that the highest value of 58 was wrongly recorded as 85 and so you correct it. How will this correction change the measures of central tendency?

options.label: A
options.text: No change in mean, decreased median

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased mean, no change in median

questions.correct_answer: B. Decreased mean, no change in median

questions.text: A child who had recently received the BCG vaccine comes to you with complaints of fever, pain and swelling at the injection site. You suspect a localised abscess formation. Which of the following steps should be avoided in the treatment of this child?

options.label: B
options.text: Incision and application of INH powder

options.label: D
options.text: Incision and application of PAS powder

questions.text: An epidemiologist has determined five independent factors influencing the outcome of a particular disease. Which of the following statistical methods can he use to compare these factors?

A person wants to study about the relationship between smoking and lung cancer, so he collects data about people diseased with lung cancer from government hospitals and the number of cigarette packets sold at the same time period. Which type of study is this?
A 27-year-old female comes to the STI clinic with minimal vaginal discharge. On speculum examination, erosions are seen on the cervix. Which of the following kit should be given to this patient?

Workers are exposed to fine dust particles during the handling and processing of raw materials. You are concerned about which particle size range would pose the greatest health risk through inhalation. Which particle size of dust inhaled would be most concerning for worker health in this setting?

A farmer brought his 16-month-old child to the OPD for routine immunization. The child has been adequately immunised. He has already received measles vaccine during a supplementary immunisation activity a few months back. What vaccines can be administered now?

options.label: A
options.text: OPV booster, DPT booster, JE vaccine and Vitamin A

options.label: B
options.text: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, and Vitamin A

options.label: C
options.text: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A

options.label: D
options.text: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, and JE.

questions.correct_answer: C. OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A

questions.text: A study was done to assess the malnutrition among young children. 100 children were selected each from rural and urban areas. Out of these, 30 among rural and 20 among urban were found to be malnourished. Which of the following statistical test is used to compare the data sets?

An investigator in a community hospital decides to examine all patients for a problem with alcoholism to determine prevalence in the community. In addition to recall bias, which of the following is the most obvious error in selecting all patients admitted to a community hospital?

A new screening test for prostate cancer becomes available. You assess whether this will be useful to your practice by reviewing the operating characteristics of the test. The test’s ability to correctly classify diseased persons as having disease is called what?
A public health physician wants to study the load of hypertension in community to design a health program for prevention of hypertension. Which is the most useful design for this case?

A resident doctor sustained a needlestick injury while sampling blood of a patient who is HIV positive. A decision is taken to offer him post-exposure prophylaxis. Which one of the following would be the best recommendation?
questions.correct_answer: C. Lamivudine + Tenofovir + Dolutegravir for 4 weeks

questions.text: A 24-month-old child weighing 11 kg was brought to the pediatric OPD. He had a respiratory rate of 38/min. On examination, chest indrawing was observed. What is the next step of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Urgent referral to the tertiary care centre immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Administer IV antibiotics and ask the patient to be brought after 24 hours

questions.correct_answer: A. Oral amoxicillin for five days

questions.text: A patient comes with a history of clean-cut injury which is not lacerated. He says that he received his last dose of tetanus vaccination about 10 years ago. What should be given next?

In a developing country, a team of public health researchers is conducting a study to assess the demographic trends and transitions within the population. They have collected data over several decades and have observed various stages of the demographic transition model. One of the key parameters they are analyzing is the demographic gap, which represents the difference between the birth rate and the death rate within a population. In which stage is this gap negative?

A household consisting of a 35-year-old man, his pregnant wife and a child. The man's brother along with his wife is currently visiting them for a month owing to winter vacation. What type of family would the surveyor classify the household?

A school has a small outbreak were children are showing symptoms like runny nose, cough, fever and skin rash. The doctors identified it as measles outbreak. Which of the following is the correct time to give post exposure measles vaccine?
